activities.loc: Courtroom B, Third Floor - North Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bradley Alan Pagano

records.addlTxt: Calendar call on January 19, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Initial Scheduling Order

01:59 PM  Defendant Bradley Alan Pagano not in court.  Attorney Colin T Nicholson appeared by video for Bradley Alan Pagano.  Prosecuting attorney Noah M Tylenda appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Remove from calendar.

1:00 PM Defendant Bradley Alan Pagano appeared by video.  Attorney Refugio Cuco Longoria for Colin T Nicholson appeared by video for Bradley Alan Pagano.  Prosecuting attorney Margaret Nan Ginocchio appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters not guilty plea on all counts. Matter referred to Court for scheduling.
Return on warrant on October 3, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 28, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
No contact directly or indirectly with victim T.K., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. Maintain absolute sobriety. Not to possess any weapons/firearms.

10:53 AM Defendant Bradley Alan Pagano not in court.  Attorney Colin T Nicholson appeared by video for Bradley Alan Pagano.  Prosecuting attorney Margaret Nan Ginocchio appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Court orders warrant on defendant's non-appearance. Cash bond set of $200. Reviewable by Court Commissioner. RECALLED 10:59 AM Defendant Bradley Alan Pagano appeared by phone.  Prosecuting attorney Margaret Nan Ginocchio appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Warrant vacated. Previous bond reinstated.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Original warrant returned September 1, 2022
Court date given by Rock County Sheriff on bond receipt: October 3, 2022 at 1:00 pm
Return on warrant on September 6, 2022 at 10:30 am.
